qas.question: What are the two biggest reasons for resistance?
What is a common method of misuse?
What is an example of bad treatment causing resistance?
What are the two biggest reasons for antibiotics?
What is a common method of hospitals?
What is an example of bad treatment causing infections?
What as been associated with increases in suboptimal antibiotics?
Since when have symptoms and diseases been associated with emerging antibiotic resistance?

context: <a0_0><b3_0>Inappropriate antibiotic treatment and overuse<b3_0/><a0_0/> of antibiotics have contributed to the emergence of antibiotic-resistant bacteria. <a1_0><b4_0>Self prescription<b4_0/><a1_0/> of antibiotics is an example of misuse. Many antibiotics are frequently prescribed to treat symptoms or diseases that do not respond to antibiotics or that are likely to resolve without treatment. Also, incorrect or suboptimal antibiotics are prescribed for certain bacterial infections. The <a2_0><b5_0>overuse of antibiotics<b5_0/><a2_0/>, like penicillin and erythromycin, has been associated with emerging antibiotic resistance since <b7_0>the 1950s<b7_0/>. <b6_0>Widespread usage of antibiotics<b6_0/> in hospitals has also been associated with increases in bacterial strains and species that no longer respond to treatment with the most common antibiotics.
